Introduction

Park Jin Young is a famous South Korean singer, songwriter, producer, and record label executive of JYP Entertainment. He started his music career with the song “Don’t Leave Me” from his first album, Blue City.

From May 1997 to February 2011, he led JYP Entertainment and helped successful artists like Wonder Girls, TWICE, Stray Kids, and more. He is also known as one of Asia's top producers, creating back-to-back hits for different artists, such as TWICE's "Signal" and Sunmi's "24 Hours".

As a globally recognized South Korean Entertainment industry figure, J.Y. Park continues to leave a mark with his music releases, business ventures, and iconic performances.
